intro: Diodia setigera, commonly known as narrowleaf blueweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States and thrives in moist, sandy soils. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, blue or purple flowers in umbels. It is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds. Diodia setigera is characterized by its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
